titles.title: A bill to require the posting of a surety bond with respect to products manufactured in foreign countries or customs unions.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 1/6/1987--Introduced. Prohibits products that are manufactured in a foreign country or customs union from entering the United States unless the manufacturer of such products or an agent of the manufacturer posts a surety bond with the Customs Service. Requires such bond to be equal to 20 percent of the appraised value of such products. Sets forth specified requirements with respect to such bonds.
